title: Will & Grace's final season to debut nearly THREE MONTHS early
text:
The end of Will & Grace will be here sooner than expected.

NBC is moving up the debut of the classic comedy's final season by nearly three months, in order to replace the struggling sitcom Sunnyside, according to USA Today on Tuesday.

And a new promo for the 11th season of Will & Grace dropped a bombshell on Tuesday when it revealed Grace (Debra Messing) is pregnant.

Big news: A new promo for the 11th season of Will & Grace dropped a bombshell on Tuesday when it revealed Grace (Debra Messing, R) is pregnant

In the one minute trailer for the show's 'farewell season', Grace tells a random woman on the subway, 'I'm pregnant!'.

'Aren't you a little-' begins the stranger, to which Grace interjects: 'Old?! Yes!'

Will (Eric McCormack) also comments on their characters' relatively advanced ages.

'By the time this baby's my age I'll be, well, I'll be dead.'

And Jack (Sean Hayes) quips of the pregnancy: 'You're trying to cook a baby in an old 1970s Easy-Bake, lady,'

Laugh fest: Will (Eric McCormack, L) also comments on their characters' relatively advanced ages

Comic relief: And Jack (Sean Hayes) quips of the pregnancy: 'You're trying to cook a baby in an old 1970s Easy-Bake, lady'

Will & Grace's final season is set to debut October 24, rather than its original early 2020 debut.

It will take the time slot of NBC's poorly-rating Sunnyside.

Meanwhile, the Kal Penn-starring freshman comedy will be moving to the network's streaming service, according to USA Today.

The publication stated that 'the series will remain in production and stream six remaining episodes online, each Thursday, along with a newly added seventh.'

The NBC app and NBC.com will show the remaining episodes.
description: NBC is moving up the debut of the classic comedy's final season by nearly three months, in order to replace the struggling sitcom Sunnyside, according to USA Today.
